citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Flexithrix Lewin 1970
Flexithrix (Fle′xi.thrix. L. adj. flexilis flexible; Gr. n. thrix hair; N.L. fem. n. Flexithrix flexible hair).
The morphological characteristics of this genus are described by Reichenbach (1989).
Positive for oxidase, catalase, alkaline phosphatase and acid phosphatase.
Predominant fatty acids are 16 : 1ω5c and iso-15 : 0.
This genus belongs to the phylum Bacteroidetes.
The type species is Flexithrix dorotheae.
